feed.title: Rife Lab
feed.subtitle: Research lab at Clemson University developing new tools for plant breeding.

entry.title: Blake Wilson joins Rife Lab!
entry.content: Blake Wilson has joined the Rife Lab as a mechanical engineer.
entry.summary: Blake Wilson has joined the Rife Lab as a mechanical engineer.

entry.title: McKena Wilson joins Rife Lab!
entry.content: McKena Wilson has joined the Rife Lab as a Postdoctoral Fellow. McKena will be working on the CRCIL project to integrate new tools and technologies into international breeding program.
entry.summary: McKena Wilson has joined the Rife Lab as a Postdoctoral Fellow. McKena will be working on the CRCIL project to integrate new tools and technologies into international breeding program.

entry.title: Announcing CRCIL
entry.content:
Rife Lab joins the new USAID Climate Resilient Cereals Innovation Lab

The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) announced today that it has funded a new $22 million project to support the development of climate resilient cereals.

The Rife Lab will support this project through the development and deployment of phenotyping and phenomics tools for plant breeding.

We will be hiring a postdoctoral research associate in collaboration with the Hershberger Lab.

Interested? Apply online by May 29, 2024 for full consideration.

For more information on the project, please see this article in Clemson News and our project website.
entry.summary: Rife Lab joins the new USAID Climate Resilient Cereals Innovation Lab

entry.title: Prasad Kamath joins Rife Lab!
entry.content: Prasad Kamath has joined the Rife Lab as a developer. Prasad will be working on PhenoApps projects.
entry.summary: Prasad Kamath has joined the Rife Lab as a developer. Prasad will be working on PhenoApps projects.

entry.title: Walker Spivey joins Rife Lab!
entry.content: Walker Spivey has joined the Rife Lab as a PhD student. Walker will be working to develop and apply new phenomics technologies to butterbeans and maize.
entry.summary: Walker Spivey has joined the Rife Lab as a PhD student. Walker will be working to develop and apply new phenomics technologies to butterbeans and maize.

entry.title: Bryan Ellerbrock joins Rife Lab!
entry.content: Bryan Ellerbrock has joined the Rife Lab as a developer. Bryan will be working on PhenoApps projects and be the primary point person for training and app extension.
entry.summary: Bryan Ellerbrock has joined the Rife Lab as a developer. Bryan will be working on PhenoApps projects and be the primary point person for training and app extension.

entry.title: Mason McNair joins Rife Lab!
entry.content: Mason McNair completed his PhD at the University of Georgia before joining the Rife Lab in October. He’ll be working on applying 3D design and printing to phenotyping and phenomics problems.
entry.summary: Mason McNair completed his PhD at the University of Georgia before joining the Rife Lab in October. He’ll be working on applying 3D design and printing to phenotyping and phenomics problems.
